result.execSummary:
The defendant Nicole M. Pelletier was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case. One or more other charges in this case were dismissed. The dismissed charges were not proven and have no legal effect. Nicole M. Pelletier is presumed innocent of the dismissed charges.

  • Nicole M. Pelletier was found guilty of OWI (5th or 6th), a class H felony, Wisconsin Statutes 346.63(1)(a).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

records.addlTxt:
3:00 p.m. Defendant Nicole M. Pelletier in court with attorney Gary S. Cirilli.  Steven Mitchell Michlig appeared for the State of Wisconsin. In 15ct26 - Defendant enters no contest plea. Plea questionnaire filed.   Court reads on waiver of rights and tendering plea. Waiver free and voluntary. Court finds that a factual basis for the plea exists and finds defendant guilty. In 15CM243 State moves to Amend Count 1 to OWI-5th - a Felony and files Amended Complaint. Defendant waives preliminary hearing. Waiver free and voluntary. Court finds that probable cause exists and binds over. State files Information - Cirilli in receipt of Information - waives further reading and enters no contest plea.  State moves to dismiss Count 2 in 15CM243 - Granted. Court reads on waiver of rights and tendering plea. Waiver free and voluntary. Court finds that a factual basis for the plea exists and finds defendant guilty. Michlig/Cirilli/Defendant/Court statement on sentencing.
Court Sentence
WHS/POP - 3 years
CC/DNA Surcharge/Supervision Fees
  Fine/Forfeiture/Court Costs are not a condition of probation and are to be paid in full directly to the Clerk of Court's Office within 60 days or date provided by Court, unless a payment plan has been approved and set up through the Clerk of Court's Office.
Fine - $2009 in 15ct26; Court costs only in 15cm243.
Take all prescribed medications and only in dosage/manner as prescribed.
No operation of motor vehicle unless cleared by medical physician.
Jail - 6 months on 15CM243 with Huber for all purposes. To commence on/before Friday April 29, 2016 at 4:00 p.m. 
Jail -  60 days on 15ct26 cc w/15cm243 with Huber for all purposes. To commence on/before Friday April 29, 2016 at 4:00 p.m. 
AODA Assessment
Driver's Safety Plan
Driver's license revocation - 26 months on each case - CC
IID - 12 months
DNA Sample
  The court informs defendant of right to request expungement of the DNA under Wis. Stat. 165.77(4).
Any other conditions/counseling deemed appropriate by PO.
Appeal rights given. Payment plan application given.
Adj. 3:23 p.m. 
  Review hearing scheduled for July 18, 2016 at 03:00 pm.

02:15 pm - Attorney Gary S. Cirilli in court.  Defendant does not appear.  Michael William Schiek appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Calling 15ct26 and 15cm243.  Schiek states drug screen back in case 15ct26, is not back for case 15cm243.  Adjournment requested for a global resolution.  Bail continued.  Adjourned 02:16 p.m.  Pre-trial conference scheduled for October 27, 2015 at 01:30 pm.
States Reply to Discovery  and State's Demand for Discovery
Take prescribed medications only as prescribed and in manner/dosage prescribed - In unable to post cash bond - may attend inpatient treatment at Koinonia.

01:56 pm - Defendant Nicole M. Pelletier in court, via video, in custody.  Jodie L. Bednar appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Defendant Nicole M. Pelletier in court with attorney Gary S. Cirilli.    In receipt of complaint, waive reading - not guilty plea.  Bednar/Cirilli to bond.  Court sets cash bond.  Transfer to BR II.  Pre-trial conference scheduled for July 28, 2015 at 01:30 pm.
